remarks: Define the class of maximal ideals of a ring ` R ` .  A proper ideal is called maximal if it is maximal with respect to inclusion among proper ideals.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 5-Jan-2011.)
statement:
df-maxidl $p |- MaxIdl = ( r e. RingOps |-> { i e. ( Idl ` r ) | ( i =/= ran ( 1st ` r ) /\ A. j e. ( Idl ` r ) ( i C_ j -> ( j = i \/ j = ran ( 1st ` r ) ) ) ) } ) $.
$d i j r $.
